thread.title: U.S. Fed awards $125.64 bln in reverse repos
thread.title_full: U.S. Fed awards $125.64 bln in reverse repos

title: U.S. Fed awards $125.64 bln in reverse repos
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Fri, Oct 23, 2015, 19:42 BST - UK Markets closed U.S. Fed awards $125.64 bln in reverse repos Reuters - UK Focus â€“ 1 hour 13 minutes ago 437.20 +14.60 
NEW YORK, Oct (HKSE: 3366-OL.HK - news ) 23 (Reuters) - The Federal Reserve awarded $125.64 billion of three-day fixed-rate reverse repurchase agreements on Friday to 52 bidders at an interest rate of 0.05 percent, the New York Fed said on its website. 
It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) was the first decline in the award amount in 1-1/2 weeks. 
On Thursday, the Fed had allotted $152.87 billion in overnight reverse repos to 61 bidders, including Wall Street dealers, money market mutual funds and mortgage finance agencies, also at an interest rate of 0.05 percent. 
That was the highest amount since $156.56 billion was awarded on Oct. 5. 
The overnight interest rate in the repurchase agreement, or repo, market was last quoted at zero to 0.07 percent, compared with 0.12 percent on Thursday, according to ICAP (LSE: IAP.L - news ) . 
In the repo market, money funds and other investors make short-term loans to banks and Wall Street dealers. Banks and dealers pledge Treasuries and other securities as collateral. (Reporting by Richard Leong; Editing by Dan Grebler)
